intro: Syringodea, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and its tall, unbranched stems that bear clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is native to parts of North America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Syringodea species are perennial herbs that typically bloom in early spring. The genus is noted for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
